definition: ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements

sentences.english: Martyr's Shrine, the creation of an ominous era, carried out maintenance of the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 忠烈祠，創建年代不祥，清代進行過維修。

sentences.english: Performance by the guards at Martyr's Shrine in Taipei.
sentences.chinese: 衛兵儀隊交接儀式在臺北的忠烈祠。

sentences.english: They are the martyrs of the new time who we respect very much.
sentences.chinese: 他們都是我們崇拜的新時代的忠烈人士。

definition: to sacrifice one's life by loyalty (to one's prince, one's husband etc)
to sacrifice oneself in a just cause/a victim of a disaster
to vow to fight to the death
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country
ready to die to preserve one's chastity
to give to the departed/to confer (a title) posthumously
